Key Match Events: Rhys Hoskins launched a grand slam in the first inning on Friday.
The Brewers stole nine bases without getting caught.
The Brewers used clutch hits in the fourth inning against Jose Quintana and piled on in the eighth inning against Reed Garrett and Danny Young.
Six Milwaukee pitchers held the Mets to two hits and zero runs on Saturday.
Pre-Game Insights: Brewers manager Pat Murphy emphasized the team's versatility, saying, 'We got to be able to beat you in more than one way.'
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo praised the Brewers' bullpen, stating, 'Brewers are the best bullpen in the NL.'
Carlos Mendoza acknowledged the Brewers' elite pitching, saying, 'They’ve got elite stuff.'

Brandon Nimmo reflected on the Brewers' performance, saying, 'They’ve done a really good job of executing and having some clutch hits when they need them. They’re a good team. There’s a reason they won the NL Central.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers are locked in as the No. 3 seed in the National League and are awaiting a matchup with the third wild card team.
The Brewers have the second-best save percentage in the game and excellent defensive work, with players like Brice Turang, Joey Ortiz, and Sal Frelick being notable defenders.
